issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Fixing YARN+MR to allow MR jobs to be able to use java.io.File.createTempFile to create temporary files as part of their tasks.

fields.summary: Problem in setting the childTmpDir in MapReduceChildJVM

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: container-launch.sh specifies java option java.io.tmpdir when executing the java process for the child container but fails to create the tmpdir. All uses of createTempFile and other commands relying on java.io.tmpdir will fail when called from child container jvms.

comments.body:
Adding a patch that illustrates the error.

Example:
hadoop jar hadoop-mapreduce-examples-0.23.1-SNAPSHOT.jar randomwriter -Dmapreduce.randomwriter.mapsperhost=1 /rw1
This issue exists both using the default container executor and the linux container executor. So both need to be tested with this change.

There are differences in 23+ about tmp dir location now being under the current working dir. Due to this, could not add back the tmp dir creation in MapReduceChildJVM.java. Opted to move the tmp dir creation to the DefaultContainerExecutor/container-executor with the rest of the directory creation. Had difficulty adding tests for this since DefaultContainerExecutor tests are disabled.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12511896/MAPREDUCE-3716.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestJobClientGetJob
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestMRWithDistributedCache
                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestLocalModeWithNewApis

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1677//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1677//console

This message is automatically generated.
Core test failures are from MAPREDUCE-3729

Patch looks fine overall.

For MR case, we already have "mapreduce.task.tmp.dir". Ideally we will want to support this, but that seems too much of a change to me as it needs to passed as part of each container-request. Not much of use anyways.

I guess we can live with "./tmp". In that case, we should
 - definitely remove "mapreduce.task.tmp.dir" from mapped-default.xml
 - declare this a YARN level constant and use this throughout - MapReduceChildJVM, DefaultContainerExecutor
 - emit a warning in JobClient if someone configures it to be other than "./tmp".

Also, a test for this is useful, please see if you can port {{TestMiniMRChildTask}} to MiniMRYarnCluster.

@Jon,
 Mind taking a look at the improvements Vinod suggested?
Good comments, Vinod. Work in progress.

bq.   * definitely remove "mapreduce.task.tmp.dir" from mapped-default.xml
done
bq.   * declare this a YARN level constant and use this throughout - MapReduceChildJVM, DefaultContainerExecutor
done
bq.   * emit a warning in JobClient if someone configures it to be other than "./tmp".
done mapreduce.task.tmp.dir is marked a final var and produces a warning
bq.   * Also, a test for this is useful, please see if you can port TestMiniMRChildTask to MiniMRYarnCluster.
done. ported the TestMiniMRChildTask#testTaskTempDir

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12512489/MAPREDUCE-3716.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1715//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1715//console

This message is automatically generated.

+1. This looks good.

It'll helpful if we enable the remaining tests in TestMiniMRChildTask. But I'll open a separate ticket for that.
I just committed this to trunk and branch-0.23. Thanks Jonathan!
